plugins.name: OKLCH Color Ramp
plugins.description:
Overview

The OKLCH Color Ramp Generator is a powerful Figma plugin designed to help designers create beautiful, perceptually uniform color scales using the OKLCH color space. This innovative tool addresses the common challenge of creating consistent and visually pleasing color ramps in design systems.


Key Features


1. Advanced Color Space Implementation

- Utilizes the OKLCH color space, which offers superior color interpolation compared to traditional RGB or HSL

- Ensures perceptually uniform steps between colors, making the resulting ramps more visually harmonious

- Provides more accurate color relationships, especially important for accessibility and design system consistency


2. User-Friendly Interface

- Simple and intuitive input system for base colors

- Customizable number of steps in the color ramp (default: 12)

- One-click generation of complete color scales


3. Smart Layout and Organization

- Automatically arranges color swatches in a horizontal layout

- Includes color information display (hex codes and intended OKLCH values)

- Automatic selection and zoom to the generated color ramp

- Clean, organized presentation of color information


Benefits for Designers


1. Time Efficiency

- Rapid generation of color scales

- Eliminates manual color interpolation

- Reduces the chance of errors in color calculations


2. Design Quality

- Ensures consistent visual steps between colors

- Creates more accessible color combinations

- Maintains color harmony across the design system


3. Workflow Integration

- Seamlessly fits into existing Figma workflows

- Provides immediate visual feedback

- Easy to iterate and adjust color scales


Future Development

The plugin is actively maintained with planned improvements:

- Enhanced color information display

- Additional customization options for color ramp generation

- Request feature in comments
plugins.tagline: Generate stunning, perceptually uniform color ramps effortlessly.

plugins.name: Circle Packing
plugins.description:
Packing circles with random sizes in a given shape.


Please try the tutorial below first


Tutorial

  1. Create a Frame with a white background and set its size to 400 x 400.
  2. Draw a black circle (#000000) with a size of 300 x 300, centered within the frame.
  3. Open the plugin and make sure the Mask Color is black (#000000)
  4. Select the Frame and click "Generate."
  5. Adjust the settings and enjoy!


Input Settings

  1. Mask Color: The part inside the frame where circles can be generated inside.
  2. Filter Quality: (0 - 100%) In a large Frame, reducing filter quality will help it generate faster.


Output Settings

  1. Num of Circles: (1 - 10,000) The maximum number of circles that can be generated.
  2. Circle Color: The color of the generated circles.
  3. Min. Radius: (1 - 10,000) The smallest radius for the generated circles.
  4. Max. Radius: (1 - 10,000) The largest radius for the generated circles. If the minimum and maximum values differ, each circle's radius will be randomly chosen between these two values.
  5. Padding Radius: (0 - 10,000) The extra radius (space) between circles to prevent them from overlapping.
  6. Bias: (0 - 10,000) When set to 0, circles have an equal chance to be any size between the minimum and maximum. When set to 1 or higher, circles will tend to be either very large (first) or very small (if it cannot fit).
  7. Num of Attempts: (1 - 1000) The number of tries to add circles. For example, if the number of circles is set to 500 and attempts are set to 5, the plugin will try to generate 500 circles. If the first attempt fails, it will try up to 5 times. This means it will try up to 2,500 times or stop once 500 circles are successfully created.


Pricing

  1. 10 free uses with full access to all features.
  2. Unlock unlimited access and future updates for a one-time purchase.
plugins.tagline: Generate Random Circles inside Given Shape

plugins.name: Digital Wellbeing Lens
plugins.description:
Plugin made for research purposes at Politecnico di Torino.


This plugin helps to design better applications relatively to digital wellbeing.


How to use it:

  1. Open the plugin and insert your OpenAI API key.
  2. Select one or multiple designed screen and click on "Scan" to receive the report for each screen, which consists on the list of detected design patterns relevant for digital wellbeing.
  3. Flag a design pattern as incorrectly detected if you think the system is wrong.
  4. Try to use the suggested solutions present in the report to correct your design, and when you feel satisfied run a new scan.
  5. Re-iterate whenever you feel like you need some suggestions on how much you are aligned with digital wellbeing design guidelines.
plugins.tagline: Check your design for patterns damaging to digital wellbeing

plugins.name: Plus Also Studios for Figma
plugins.description:
Rollout

Sync your images and copy with your main component designs in Figma to rollout multiple sizes and variations of your creative. This plugin is great for generating static or multi frame ads with lightening speed.

Features include:

  1. Resize your designs based on your main figma components
  2. Sync your content with a spreadsheet to create additional sizes and image and copy variations.
  3. The plugin automatically chooses the best template to use for new creative sizes.
  4. Group your creative variations on one page or multiple.
  5. Batch rename to your output files using formulas in your spreadsheet.


Generative AI

Extend your images, remove background, or generate new images directly from Figma.


Optimised Exports

Exporting images and optimise them (both lossy and lossless mode).


Display

Export multi-frame storyboards as production ready HTML5 display banners that are ready to publish. The output files are also compatible with Google Web Designer, in-case you want to craft your animations further.

Features include:

  1. Animate and export multi-frame banner designs with one click, from Figma.
  2. Control the duration of each frame.
  3. Add intro animations to each frame.
  4. Add outro animations to each frame.
  5. Auto animate button rollovers.
  6. Control the frame animation order.


plusalso is only available to subscribers. To trial or signup for an account, contact our team at support@plusalsostudios.com.au


Support

For additional support, get in touch with us at support@plusalsostudios.com.au
plugins.tagline: Supercharge your creative production workflow with Plus Also Studios

Designed to seamlessly integrate with your design process, this plugin harnesses the power of AI to translate your Figma frames into over 70 languages. Localize your app icons, store page screenshots, ad creatives, and more with unparalleled ease and accuracy. Learn more


Features and Benefits:


AI-Powered Translation: Instantly translate your design elements within Figma, leveraging cutting-edge AI for accurate and context-sensitive translations.

Wide Language Support: Offering translations in over 70 languages, the Apployal Localize plugin ensures your app resonates with users worldwide.

Effortless Localization of Media Assets: Easily translate app icons, screenshots for app store pages, ad creatives, and other media directly in Figma, saving time and streamlining your workflow.

Tailored for wide users range: Whether you're a designer fine-tuning app visuals, app owner that want expand global reach, or marketer creating localized ad campaigns, this plugin simplifies your work without the need for external translation tools or services.


Google Play and App Store integration:

Get Started Today:


Step into the world of efficient and effective app localization with the Apployal Localize Figma Plugin. Expand your app's global reach with localized visuals that speak directly to your audience, no matter where they are.


Note:

This plugin requires account of Apployal Localize.


24/7 Support:


Our dedicated support team is always on hand to assist you with any questions or help you might need in navigating app localization with our Figma plugin.


Contact us

plugins.name: Ollama Auto Fill
plugins.description:
Ollama Auto Fill


Before Use:

Please install and run Ollama according to my tutorial:


  1. Tutorial: document
  2. For more information, please visit my official website: https://figma.comfyui.asia


Description

Ollama Auto Fill is a powerful Figma plugin that leverages the Ollama local large language model to automatically generate and fill text content. Designed specifically for designers, this tool can quickly generate multiple unique text items and automatically populate them into selected Figma text components, significantly enhancing design efficiency.


Key Features

Generate high-quality text using the Ollama local large language model

Support batch generation of multiple unique text items

Automatically fill generated text into selected Figma text components

Clean and intuitive user interface for easy operation

Real-time selection updates and error prompts for a smooth user experience


How It Works

1. Install the Ollama Auto Fill plugin in Figma

2. Ensure the local Ollama service is running (default address: http://localhost:11434)

3. Select one or more text components in your Figma design

4. Run the Ollama Auto Fill plugin

5. Enter your prompt in the plugin interface

6. Click the "Generate Text" button

7. Wait for text generation to complete, and the generated text will automatically fill the selected text components


Why Use Ollama Auto Fill?

Save time: Quickly generate realistic and contextually appropriate text content

Enhance creativity: Get inspired by AI-generated text for your designs

Improve workflow: Seamlessly integrate text generation into your Figma design process

Maintain privacy: Utilize a local language model for data security


Requirements

Figma desktop app

Locally installed and running Ollama service (default address: http://localhost:11434)


Notes

Ensure the Ollama service is running locally and accessible

The plugin requires at least one text component to be selected to generate text

The number of generated text items will match the number of selected text components


Ollama Auto Fill streamlines your design process by providing instant, high-quality text content. Try it now and experience the power of local AI-assisted text generation in your Figma designs!
plugins.tagline: A Figma plugin that uses the Ollama local language model to auto-generate and fill text

plugins.name: Apply Absolute Auto Layout
plugins.description:
Apply Absolute Auto Layout


Have you ever applied auto layout to an icon frame, only for it to resize the frame and reposition the vectors inside of it? Here is the solution to your auto layout woes!


This plugin applies the following to each selected frame:


  1. Set auto layout, center alignment on both axes, fixed width and height, and restore original frame dimensions
  2. For each immediate vector child layer, apply absolute positioning and restore original x/y coordinates within the parent frame


And that's it!


GitHub Repository: https://github.com/Saeris/apply-absolute-auto-layout
plugins.tagline: Apply autolayout to your icons without risk of resizing or elements repositioning!

plugins.name: Modyo Color Palette
plugins.description:
The Modyo Color Palette Generator is a powerful tool designed to help you create comprehensive color palettes in the Modyo style. This plugin not only generates a series of tints and shades based on a selected base color but also provides crucial contrast information to ensure accessibility compliance.


Features:


  • Color Picker: Easily select your base color using a convenient color picker.
  • Color Variations: Generate a palette with multiple shades and tints from your base color.
  • Accessibility Compliance: Automatically calculate and display contrast ratios for each color against white and black backgrounds. The plugin also indicates whether each color meets AAA or AA standards for large and small text as well as graphics.
  • Hex Codes and Identifiers: View the hex codes and identifiers (e.g., color-25, color-50) for each generated color.


How to Use:


  • Open the Plugin: Launch the Modyo Color Palette Generator from your Figma plugins menu.
  • Enter Color Details: Input a color name and select your base color using the color picker.
  • Generate Palette: Click the "Generate Palette" button to create a comprehensive palette.
  • Review Results: The plugin will display a vertical layout of the generated colors, each with its hex code, identifier, and contrast ratio details.


Limitations:


  • Single Base Color: The palette is generated based on a single base color. For multiple base colors, you need to run the plugin separately for each color.
  • Static Contrast Values: The contrast calculations are based on standard white and black backgrounds only.
  • Manual Adjustments: Any additional adjustments to the generated palette must be done manually in Figma.


This plugin is an essential tool for designers looking to maintain color consistency and accessibility in their projects, ensuring that all color choices are both aesthetically pleasing and compliant with accessibility standards.
plugins.tagline: Generate Modyo-style color palettes with AAA/AA contrast

  • Generate Palette: Click the "Generate Palette" button to create a comprehensive palette.
  • Review Results: The plugin will display a vertical layout of the generated colors, each with its hex code, identifier, and contrast ratio details.


Limitations:


  • Single Base Color: The palette is generated based on a single base color. For multiple base colors, you need to run the plugin separately for each color.
  • Static Contrast Values: The contrast calculations are based on standard white and black backgrounds only.
  • Manual Adjustments: Any additional adjustments to the generated palette must be done manually in Figma.


This plugin is an essential tool for designers looking to maintain color consistency and accessibility in their projects, ensuring that all color choices are both aesthetically pleasing and compliant with accessibility standards.
90770.tagline: Generate Modyo-style color palettes with AAA/AA contrast

plugins.name: Guideflow - AI-Powered Interactive Demos & Guides
plugins.description:
Guideflow Figma Plugin: Transform Your Figma Designs into Interactive Demos and Guides with Ease


The Guideflow Figma plugin empowers designers and non-designers alike to quickly turn Figma frames into interactive demos, step-by-step guides, GIFs, and videos. Whether youre working in product, marketing, customer success, or design, Guideflow makes it simple to create engaging, dynamic presentations from your Figma designs, without needing any coding skills.


Why use Guideflow?

Guideflow takes your Figma frames and brings them to life, providing a seamless transition from static design to interactive experience. Whether you're preparing a product demo, creating user guides, or showcasing design concepts, Guideflow allows you to elevate your communication by transforming designs into fully functional, trackable walkthroughs and videos.


Key Benefits:


Instant Interactive Demos

Export your Figma frames directly to Guideflow, where you can build interactive demos in minutes. Whether for a product demo or a UX flow, Guideflow allows you to visually guide users through the design, providing them with a hands-on experience.


Step-by-Step Walkthroughs

Create detailed walkthroughs for any use case, including user onboarding, tutorials, and internal training. Each step can be annotated with helpful instructions, animated elements, and dynamic transitions, guiding viewers through the process effortlessly.


Flexible Output Options

Choose how you want to share your interactive demos or guides. With Guideflow, you can generate interactive web demos, export GIFs, or create polished videos from your Figma frames. Whether you need a live interactive demo or a shareable video presentation, Guideflow has you covered.


Enhanced Collaboration & Feedback

Empower your entire team to participate in the design process. Guideflow allows designers, marketers, and product managers to collaborate seamlessly, sharing interactive demos or guides for feedback, validation, or user testing. Real-time sharing and engagement tracking ensure that your team and stakeholders are always on the same page.


No Code Required

Anyone can create with Guideflow, even without design or coding expertise. Simply select the frames from Figma, export to Guideflow, and start adding interactivity like animated hotspots, transitions, and voiceoversall without needing a single line of code.


Features that Set Guideflow Apart:

Customizable Elements: Add voiceovers, branching paths, embedded forms, and animated annotations to personalize your demo or guide.


Real-Time Engagement Tracking: See whos interacting with your demos, track viewer engagement, and identify drop-off points to improve your content.


Multiple Sharing Options: Share your interactive demo as a personalized link, embed it directly into websites or documents, or export it as an MP4 or GIF for easy distribution.


How to Get Started:


  1. Select Your Figma Frames: Choose the specific frames or series of frames from your Figma project that you want to bring into Guideflow.
  2. Export to Guideflow: With the click of a button, your selected frames are transferred to Guideflow, where you can begin to enhance them with interactivity, guidance, and customization.
  3. Add Interactive Elements: Use Guideflows intuitive interface to add animations, transitions, voiceovers, or text annotations. Highlight key actions and guide your audience through each step.
  4. Share & Track Engagement: Once your demo or guide is complete, share it with your team or users via a link, embed it in web pages, or export it as a video or GIF. Monitor engagement and get insights into user interactions.


Use Cases:

  1. Product Demos: Perfect for showcasing new features or flows to clients and stakeholders.
  2. User Onboarding: Build step-by-step guides to help new users get up to speed quickly and efficiently.
  3. Design Feedback: Share interactive designs with your team for feedback, reviews, or testing, ensuring everyone is aligned on the final vision.
  4. Marketing Presentations: Export stunning, animated GIFs or videos from your Figma designs to support marketing campaigns, social media, or pitches.


With the Guideflow Figma plugin, turning your designs into interactive, shareable experiences is faster and easier than ever. Whether you're creating for internal teams or external audiences, Guideflow offers the flexibility and power you need to communicate your ideas effectively.
plugins.tagline: Create interactive demos & guides from Figma

plugins.name: Transparency Reference Legend
plugins.description: The Transparency Reference Legend plugin for Figma is designed to help designers create a clear visual reference for color transparencies. With an intuitive interface, users can select a base color and specify the number of transparency levels to generate. The plugin then produces a series of shapes within a frame, each displaying the selected color with different transparency levels. Users have the flexibility to customize the size and spacing of the shapes, as well as choose the frame orientation (horizontal or vertical). This tool is ideal for designers who want to explore and document color transparencies in their projects, providing a useful reference legend for design consistency.

plugins.name: Variables Exporter For Dev Mode
plugins.description:
This plugin allows you to extract a comprehensive JSON representation of all the variables used within a Figma document. This JSON output can serve as a foundation for transforming design variables into cross-platform design tokensfor example, generating Tailwind CSS classes or integrating them into a design token pipeline like Style Dictionary.


The exported format is intentionally rich and flexible, enabling developers to write custom scripts or transformations as needed. However, the plugin also offers two configuration options that reduce the need for manual preprocessingsaving time and making integration into developer workflows more seamless:


Resolve Aliases


When enabled, this option resolves all aliases to their final, underlying values. The plugin supports cascading resolution, meaning it can follow chains of aliases until it reaches a concrete value.


A key feature here is the smart handling of multi-mode variable collections. If variables are connected through multi-mode collections, the plugin attempts to match modes based on slugified mode names. If no match is found, the target collections default mode is used instead.


Importantly, the resolution is always based on the original mode namenot the fallback.


Example:


The variable primary in the light mode of the semantics collection points to the variable blue in the primitives collection (which only contains the dark mode). That variable in turn points to blue-500 in the palettes collection, which contains both light and dark modes. In this case, resolution ultimately lands on blue-500 in the light mode, even though the intermediate blue variable belongs to a dark-only collection.


Exclude Hidden Variables


This option filters out any variables that have the "Hide from publishing" checkbox enabled in Figma.


When aliases are involved, any variable pointing to a hidden variable will still follow the alias resolution rules described above. This ensures that the exported JSON always contains usable and resolved values, even if some variables are marked as hidden in the Figma UI.
plugins.tagline: Export Figma variables to JSON-based format

plugins.name: Batch Variable Customizer
plugins.description:
Batch update variables with ease across local and external libraries!


Effortlessly update multiple variables, including colors, aliases, or names, without the hassle of editing each one individually. This plugin streamlines variable management, allowing you to update color values, manage aliases, and rename entries seamlesslywhether you're working with local collections or external libraries. Handle updates, deletions, and renaming in just a few clicks, regardless of the scale or complexity of your variables.


Features:

  1. Batch update color variables for both local and external libraries.
  2. Effortlessly rename multiple variables to maintain consistent naming conventions.
  3. Bulk delete variables for quick and efficient cleanup.


Braces notation for aliasing:

  1. For local libraries: {collectionName.variableName}
  2. For external libraries: {LibraryName/collectionName.variableName}

Use the / suggestion box to quickly browse and select variables from your libraries, ensuring precise and consistent aliasing.


Huge thanks to Jan Six for creating the Batch Styler plugin, which inspired this tool; currently supporting color variables, with plans to expand to other variable types in the future!


Limitations:

Due to Figma API constraints, updates to external libraries (such as changes to variable names, new collections, or modes) will not be automatically reflected in the plugin. To capture such updates, simply reload the Figma file, and the plugin will synchronize with the latest changes.


Questions & Support

This plugin is still a baby panda, so if you notice any bugs or have any questions, please get in touch directly. I'll help you troubleshoot and resolve any issues as quickly as possible.
plugins.tagline: Batch update, rename, and delete variables effortlessly, including colors and aliases.

plugins.name: Variables export to Gitlab
plugins.description:
Figma Variables Export Plugin Instruction


The Figma Variables plugin was developed to convert Figma Variables into SASS variables. 

To use this plugin you should have some Local variables in your Figma project


The plugin has 2 features:

  1. Export file with SASS variables in .scss format
  2. Publish file with SASS variables into Gitlab and create a merge request


Export file with SASS variables in .scss format

For exporting Figma Local Variables as SASS variables you just need to click the Export button


By clicking on the Export button the file with .scss extension will be created. It will contain all Figma local variables in SASS format.


This file can be used in the UI project that uses SASS variables. After any changes in Figma Local Variables all is needed is just to make export of variables into the project directory again and the state of Local Variables will be synchronized with the state of SASS variables in the UI project.


Publish file with SASS variables into Gitlab and create a merge request

This feature is more advanced. It suggests that SASS variables are placed in some file that is stored in a Gitlab repository. For using this feature we need to set our Gitlab settings:


  1. Gitlab Domain (gitlab.com or another)
  2. Gitlab Token (user can get it from Gitlab settings)
  3. Target branch where you should create a merge request with changes
  4. Path to file with variables (i.e. src/variables.scss)
  5. Project Id (user can see it on gitlab project's page)


By clicking on Publish button the plugin performs the next steps:

  1. Creates new branch for updates
  2. Editing the .scss file from the File Path input
  3. Creates a merge request with changes in this file from just created branch into the Target Branch


After that a person who has permissions of merging can open Gitlab, check changes and merge them.


This feature makes UI project synchronization with Figma mockups more seamless and stable. After making any changes in Figma variables, UX Designer needs only click the Publish button, and UI developer needs only check these changes in Gitlab and click Merge Changes button.
plugins.tagline: Export Figma variables to .scss file of push them to file in Gitlab repository

plugins.name: Smart Background
plugins.description:
Smart Background Color is designed to intelligently generate harmonized background colors for your selected images, giving your designs a polished, cohesive look. Whether you're working with individual images or a collection, SmartColor automatically suggests colors based on the dominant tones in your images. You can apply these smart backgrounds in several ways:


  1. Per-Image: Create individual harmonized backgrounds for each selected image.
  2. Combined Background: Generate a single, unified background color that works harmoniously with all selected images. Customize further by choosing how to apply the background
  3. New Rectangle Object: Insert a new background layer behind each image.
  4. Image Border Color: Apply the harmonized color to the border of each selected image.
  5. Artboard Background: Apply the smart background to the selected artboard for a unified look.


Enhance your workflow with Smart Background and bring harmony to your designs in just a few clicks.
plugins.tagline: Automatic background harmonization with selected images

plugins.name: ColorAura - Enhanced Shade Generator
plugins.description:
ColorAura - Enhanced Shade Generator


ColorAura turns the creation of color shades into an exact science. Using a mathematically calibrated super elliptic curve, the plugin generates professional color scales that can be customized to fit any project's needs.


Key features:

  1. Create hues based on a super elliptic curve for smooth and natural transitions
  2. Full integration with Figma Variables for a systematic approach to color
  3. Non-linear distribution for more precise gradation control
  4. Automatic text adaptation (black/white) depending on background brightness
  5. Intuitive interface with real-time visual previews


Customization for your needs:

Take full control of your color scales with adjustable super ellipse settings and distribution types. Choose between linear and step distributions, include white and black colors in your palette, or create variable-free palettes for rapid prototyping. The possibilities are endless.


Working with variables:

ColorAura seamlessly integrates with Figma Variables, automatically creating and organizing color variables into a clean, hierarchical structure. Each shade gets a meaningful name in the format "ColorName/Percent", making them intuitive to use across your design system.


Questions and Support:

For suggestions, bug reports, or general feedback, please reach out through the Figma Community or connect with me on social media (@ninsent). Your input helps make ColorAura better for everyone!
plugins.tagline: Superelliptic curve-based generator for perfect tints & shades

plugins.name: Smart Data
plugins.description:
Supercharge your text handling in Figma with Smart Data! This plugin gives you complete control over text manipulation with a wide variety of options. From sorting to generating random texts, injecting names, dates, Lorem Ipsum, and much more!


Features at a Glance


  1. Random Data : Inject randomly generated data based on your custom template.
  2. Repeat Data : Apply a single text template across all selected text layers.
  3. Generate Dates : Generate sequential date-time data with your preferred format.
  4. Random Names : Automatically assign random names based on different regions (US, APAC, LATAM, MEA, EU).
  5. Sequential Data : Seamlessly generate sequential alphanumeric data (`ABC`, `123`, `abc`, or custom patterns!).
  6. Randomize Predefined Data : Randomly pick data from a comma-separated list of possibilities and assign it to text layers.
  7. Sort Text : Automatically sort text either in ascending or descending orders (great for organizing items!).
  8. Lorem Ipsum Generator : Quickly fill text layers with dummy content using a configurable number of words.
  9. Paste Data : Easily bulk-paste excel column data into selected text layers


How To Use?


  1. Select Text Layers ( preferably on a data grid / table column ) in Figma .
  2. Launch the Plugin and choose your desired text operation.
  3. Provide any necessary input (optional, depending on the operation).
  4. Press the Change Text Button .
  5. Done! Watch as your selected text layers update in real-time.



Use Cases


  1. UI Mockups : Generate placeholder texts for wireframes.
  2. Data-driven design : Quickly align number-based designs or charts.
  3. Generating form content : Design registration forms or profile pages faster with name, date, and random data generators.
  4. Consistent repetition : Apply the same text format across several elements programmatically
plugins.tagline: Supercharge your text handling in Figma with Smart Data!
